sections.heading: protest as evidence of dishonor; bill of exchange or promissory note
sections.text: The usual protest by a notary public, without proof of his signature or notarial seal, is evidence of the dishonor and notice of a bill of exchange or promissory note.SourceR.S.1867, Code ยง 349, p. 452;R.S.1913, ยง 7905;C.S.1922, ยง
